A mammogram is an xray of the breasts.
Radiation has been cut back to a very [[small dose; https://www.cancer.org/cancer/breast-cancer/screening-tests-and-early-detection/mammograms/mammogram-basics.html/]].
You receive radiation from your environment every day. A screening mammogram contains the amount of radiation you would get from your natural environment in 7 weeks.

The MOCA (Montreal Cognitive Assesement) or MMSE (Mini-Mental State Examination)
 are tests given to patients who may have memory problems. 
Each is a series of questions and takes around 10-15 minutes.

This is a blood test to see if you are immune (protected) against rubella(german measles) or varicella (chicken pox). 
if you are non immune you may become infected with rubella during a pregnancy
which could cause birth defects or serious health problems for you.

If sexually active testing for stis includes: 
•Women: a pelvic exam or a urine test; and blood tests. 
•Men: a urine test and blood tests
Urine test tests are for Chlamydia and Gonorrhea. 
The test done by pelvic exam in women is for Chlamydia and Gonorrhea
Blood tests: it is recommended to include tests for HIV, Syphilis, Hepatitis B, and some include Hepatitis C.
